{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3149902,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T16:31:38.507Z","cooked":"

Our team is attempting to implement path planning and following with a swerve drive chassis for the first time this year and we are having some issues. It’s our first year with swerve drive and first year trying to use a path planner like Path Planner or AutoBuilder. I’m not sure we are using the correct PID values for our X, Y, and Theta pidcontrollers. I was hoping that someone would give me the basic understanding of what we’d expect to see if we had incorrect values when running a generated path. What would happen if our PID Values (mainly just P since I and D are set to 0) are too high? What about too low? In all examples I’ve looked at, I think the X and Y controllers use the same value, but the Theta is generally different. Based on my experience with tuning PID controllers, I would expect too high of a p value would cause oscillation and too low of a value would cause it not correct itself enough.

We are currently testing on a chassis-only practice bot so it only has the frame, the swerve modules and the control board so it pretty light. The programmers ran SysID on it with the wheels locked in so they can’t turn. They came up with kP value of .07777 so that’s what we are using for P for X, Y, and Theta pid controllers, which seem kind of small compared to other examples I’ve seen.

I’m mainly looking to get an understanding of how the changing of the values should effect the path generation.

Thanks in advance.

khope:

They came up with kP value of .07777 so that’s what we are using for P for X, Y, and Theta pid controllers

That is the wrong gain to use for those controllers; that is the gain for velocity control of the module drive motor. Your X, Y, and \theta controllers may cascade to velocity controllers, but they are themselves position controllers. You will likely have to tune them manually.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T16:45:20.933Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427596,"topic_slug":"what-are-the-effects-of-incorrect-pid-values-for-swerve-drive-path-following","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/what-are-the-effects-of-incorrect-pid-values-for-swerve-drive-path-following/427596/2","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3149915,"name":"Kyle Reeve","username":"kreeve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kreeve/{size}/187015_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T16:52:49.708Z","cooked":"
khope:

I’m mainly looking to get an understanding of how the changing of the values should effect the path generation.

Changing the PID values won’t affect the path generation, only the path following.

There’s a lot of variables going on when tuning path following. I would suggest you actually start with P gain of 0 and see how well your robot follows the paths with Feedforward only. See if you can adjust the paths themselves or add constraints to make it better, it should be pretty close if your module tuning is solid. Then I would start adding gains, a gain of ~1 seems to be a good starting point for both theta and translation control.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T16:52:49.708Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":18.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427596,"topic_slug":"what-are-the-effects-of-incorrect-pid-values-for-swerve-drive-path-following","display_username":"Kyle Reeve","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10385,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-are-the-effects-of-incorrect-pid-values-for-swerve-drive-path-following/427596/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3149917,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T16:53:25.860Z","cooked":"

So is it best to just start with a random value like 1? Would you expect X, Y, and Theta to be about the same? Seems like the examples I’ve seen Theta is double the X and Y value.

What are the effects of them being too low? too high?

Thanks.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T16:53:25.860Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427596,"topic_slug":"what-are-the-effects-of-incorrect-pid-values-for-swerve-drive-path-following","display_username":"khope","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31620,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4779 - The RoboSapiens"},"post_url":"/t/what-are-the-effects-of-incorrect-pid-values-for-swerve-drive-path-following/427596/4","custom_user_title":"4779 - The RoboSapiens","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3149918,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T16:55:01.382Z","cooked":"

The effect of the gains being too low or too high is as you’ve described. Pick a starting point that seems dimensionally-sane (you should know what your units are, or else you will have a tough time) and then do an exponential search.
